TopicTitle: Favorite Ethnic Foods Not Of Your Own Group Plus Your Own

Articles.Content:
My current favorite food not of my group is middle eastern food.

A well made and tasy gyro or shararma plate is awesome stuff.

 

 

 

As for my group:

 

 

Boudain: A sauage filled with seasoned rice and meat. Traditional creole food eaten with crackers. Spicy stuff.

Personally I eat them with anything. Pancakes or BBQ particularly.

 

 

So what about you?

 

Tell us of the ethnic group food you like that is not your own, plus food from the group you originate with.

 

As always... stay civil please... that's what separates KSP from other forums.

Edited December 21, 2019 by Spacescifi

I prefer the American Indians' exotic food, such as potato, tomato, sunflower, phaseolus. Sometimes corn, but rarely.

Meat, bread, and cucumbers are local.
(Though, not sure about its DNA origin. You know, Monsanto, etc.)

Edited December 22, 2019 by kerbiloid

Not of my ethnic group:

Curried goat

Schwarma

Luau pig

Steak and kidney pie

Blood sausage

Real gumbo

 

Of my ethnic group:

Big 'ole Burger piled with cheese & bacon

Mac and cheese (home made)

Jerky

Fried chicken

Fall off the bone 18 hours smoked bbq ribs

Steak!

So USA?

Me as well.

As for Kerbaloid... Russia? Although the foods mentioned can be found... almost anywhere in industrial nations.

1 hour ago, Spacescifi said:

As for Kerbaloid... Russia? Although the foods mentioned can be found... almost anywhere in industrial nations.

Yes, Kerbaloid is Russian, he speaks the language of the русский

(Every time when somebody refers to @Kerbaloid instead of me, one more tree gets cut in a tropical forest. Save the nature.

And I have no idea what country he is from).

Some nations stack the burger components, others put them around the plate.
In the first case this is unhealthy fastfood, in the second case it's a healthy natural cuisine. That's how magic of place works.

yup, USA. Born in Tennessee, lived in florida the last 30 someodd years. I'm a 42 year old diabetic Systems and Network admin. Once in awhile I do eat unhealthy, same as once in awhile I love a good two fingers of 18 year aged Irish whiskey.  My wife loves food, as do I, and she has introduced me to many things I had heard of but never tried. She is a first rate Cook, and at the moment is thinly slicing a Jewish brisket for dinner tonight.

Mostly I eat healthy, but sometimes good 'ole soul food is the thing I crave. Gotta go, my turn to go slice. happy holidays to all, whatever and wherever you are! We're all human!

 

P.S. +1 on the schwarma!
Chicken tikka. Can’t live without it
